page.title: 10ALDROUGHTY FARM
page.content:
Aldroughtry Farm Elgin
Barley grown on the farm is included in the pig rations and the pigs are an important part of the commercial undertaking. 60 sows are kept to produce bacon. Daily readings are taken from the farm's Met station. The contents of the aphid trap are counted. The information gathered is used to advise farmers when to spray crops. Because of the slump in the whisky trade the demand for barley is dropping and farmers are looking for alternative crops. Among those being tested st Aldroughty are linseed, flax, spring beans, combining peas,grain lupins, quinoa, evening primrose, borage and spring oilseed rape.
